title: Strength-Based Self-Esteem Building
description: A reminiscence-based routine designed for ADHD and autistic individuals. Uses positive memory recall, strength identification, and practical application to build authentic self-esteem that honors neurodivergent strengths and experiences.

setupSteps.question: What's your biggest self-esteem challenge? (recognizing strengths, feeling proud of achievements, or believing in your abilities)
What time of day do you feel most reflective and positive?
What's your preferred way to record memories? (writing, voice notes, drawing, or photos)
What's one thing you're naturally good at? (This will be your 'strength anchor' for building confidence)
What helps you feel proud of yourself? (recognition, accomplishment, helping others, or something else)

steps.message: üåü Strength-building time! Let's work with your ${mainSelfEsteemChallenge} using reminiscence strategies designed for neurodivergent brains.
üìù Memory recall: Use your ${memoryCaptureMethod} to describe a moment when you felt proud or joyful (no pressure to be perfect)
üí™ Strength identification: What personal strength does this moment reveal about you? (creativity, persistence, kindness, etc.)
üåô Evening reflection: How do you feel when you think about that memory? (your brain is building positive associations)
‚úÖ Celebration: 'I'm recognizing my authentic strengths!' (your neurodivergent brain is building self-awareness)
üåü Strength-building time! Your brain is learning to recognize and celebrate your strengths. Time to build your strength profile.
üìã Strength gathering: Review your recorded strengths from the past week and list them all (your brain is building a strength database)
‚≠ê Top three selection: Choose three strengths that matter most to you and why they're important (include your ${strengthAnchor})
üéØ Application planning: Name one situation for each strength where you could actively use it in daily life
‚úÖ Celebration: 'I'm building a strength-based identity!' (your neurodivergent brain is creating positive self-concept)
üåü Strength-building time! Time to actively apply your strengths in daily life.
üåÖ Morning strength choice: Choose one strength you want to actively use today (this sets your intention)
üéØ Throughout the day: Notice opportunities to use your chosen strength (no pressure, just awareness)
üåô Evening strength review: When did you use your strength today? What was the experience like? (use your ${prideTrigger} to celebrate)
‚úÖ Celebration: 'I'm living from my authentic strengths!' (your neurodivergent brain is building confidence)
